message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about neural abstractive summarization, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The paper specifically focuses on controlling the amount of verbatim copying in abstractive summarization, which involves language modeling and alternative mechanisms for generating summary hypotheses. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related topics. Other likely sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), as these sub-categories also cover topics related to NLP and machine learning.
